intro: Eriophorum × polystachiovaginatum, commonly known as the hybrid cottongrass, is a low-growing perennial herb native to northern regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and grass-like plants. The plant is characterized by its fluffy, white seed heads that resemble cotton, which are produced at the end of its flowering stems. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, often covered with fine, soft hairs. Eriophorum × polystachiovaginatum typically grows in wet, boggy habitats and is adapted to cold climates.
